question.title: What is the correct technique for inserting a peripheral venous line?
question.description: The technique for inserting a peripheral venous line involves

option_a.title: Inserting the needle at a 45-degree angle and advancing it slowly
option_a.description: This is the correct technique for inserting a peripheral venous line

option_b.title: Inserting the needle directly into the vein without any angle or speed control
option_b.description: This is a common mistake that can lead to complications

option_c.title: Using a pre-filled catheter and injecting the contrast agent before insertion
option_c.description: This is a technique used in some cases, but not for peripheral venous lines

option_d.title: Using ultrasound guidance for accurate placement
option_d.description: This is a technique used in some cases, but not always necessary or recommended
